description: Start of a string of exactly 3 consecutive (but disjoint) pairs of twin primes.
references: Posting to Number Theory List (NMBRTHRY(AT)LISTSERV.NODAK.EDU), Nov. 19 1998.
links: Sebastian Petzelberger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(2)=179 because (179,181),(191,193),(197,199) is the second occurrence (after (5,7),(11,13),(17,19)) of exactly 3 pairs of twin primes.
mathematica: Select[Prime@ Range@ 30000, And[ NextPrime[#, -1] - NextPrime[#, -2] != 2, NextPrime@ # - # == 2, NextPrime[#, 3] - NextPrime[#, 2] == 2, NextPrime[#, 5] - NextPrime[#, 4] == 2, NextPrime[#, 7] - NextPrime[#, 6] > 2] &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 25 2015 *)
author: Randall Rathbun
